author: Amazon Customer

review: I have 2 chromecasts already, they are pretty good for what they are advertised for, and for the price. So, I was excited when fire tv stick was announced that purpoted double the memory and a better wifi(dual-band antenna).  The shipping was fast.When the device was delivered, I was excited and plugged the stick into my TV and was on my way to set it up. Connected to my wireless, then the stick started to download the upgrade, I was waiting, and waiting and waiting, and suddenly there was an error message saying download failed please reboot after a while or call the number.. for support. I rebooted and tried again, it failed again. Tried like 15 times and failed everytime. (my wifi is pretty fast and router is not too far from the TV, chromecast does the updates instantly). After many tries finally, the final download took an hour or so when the progress bar slowly made it to the end, when it successfully finished downloading. My guess is the wifi antenna for some of the sticks is defective. The dual antenna, instead of helping is hurting by interfering with each other.The install was relatively fast.Streaming had some problems initially but now it's pretty smooth but I don't get the HD level detail usually probably because of the wifi antenna issue.I would have returned the item if I had a store nearby, but as it's Amazon, i don't want to go through the hassle of paying for the return shipment and mail it. So, I am forced to keep it instead. This is one reason I am skeptical of shopping from amazon. If there's an equal valued item at a nearby store, i prefer to buy at the store.I gave it 2 stars because it's atleast playing videos.

review: I didn't want to wait until January so I bought this at a local store for $25. I am so glad I didn't wait! This has already replaced my Chromecast. This does everything that Chromecast does, plus I can watch Prime TV and movies without having to cast my phone screen. If I had known this was coming out, I wouldn't have wasted my money on Chromecast. The remote that comes with it is handy. There is also an app available for download if you would rather use your voice or a keyboard for searching.
